result.execSummary:
The defendant Randolph J Sottile was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Sentence credit for 2 days was granted.
If the defendant has any drug related infractions during the course of probation, the DOC should immediately seek revocation of probation.

miscConds.notes:
Reimbursement for Buy Money to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Waukesha Metro Drug Unit.  Bail applied to Buy Money and DNA Surcharge.  Paid in full.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.
No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescriptions drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
